author: By Jonathan O'Callaghan
title: What will replace the International Space Station?
description: The International Space Station has been ever-present in our lives for more than two decades. What will happen when we lose it in 2031?

author: By Mark Piesing
title: The crazy plan to explode a nuclear bomb on the Moon
description: In the 1950s, with the USSR seemingly sprinting ahead in the space race, US scientists hatched a bizarre plan – nuking the surface of the Moon to frighten the Soviets.

author: By Dhananjay Khadilkar
title: Why scientists are making fake Moon dust
description: With humanity looking to set foot on the Moon again for the first time in 50 years, space agencies around the world need lunar soil – lots of it.

author: By Sue Nelson
title: What it takes to make a suit fit for the Moon
description: Later this decade, humans will stand on the lunar surface once more. The suits they will wear will be far more advanced than those of the Apollo astronauts.

author: By Richard Hollingham
title: The epic quest to build a permanent Moon base
description: The handful of astronauts who have set foot on the Moon spent as little as a day on the surface. How do you build a settlement that will last for years?
